question: 下唇
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>bottom</kanji> <kanji>lip</kanji> is your <vocabulary>lower lip</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>bottom lip</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
<ja>したくちびる</ja> is the vocab reading for <ja>下</ja> and the reading you learned with the kanji for <ja>唇</ja>. This is how you'd usually read this word.

<ja>かしん</ja> is very technical and it's rarely used outside of scientific writing. If you don't plan to read science papers in Japanese, you can ignore this reading!
